intro: Kneiffia pilosella, commonly known as the hairy sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. Kneiffia pilosella is well adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
